title: Ticket #2282: Automatic TransferOutputRemaps broken when transfer IF_NEEDED -> NO
description:
Failure - 

$ cat > remap_transfer_not_needed.sub
#NUM_CPUS = 1
#FILESYSTEM_DOMAIN = A
#STARTD.FILESYSTEM_DOMAIN = A
#STARTER.FILESYSTEM_DOMAIN = A
#STARTER_DEBUG = D_FULLDEBUG

cmd=/bin/echo
args=OK

should_transfer_files=if_needed
when_to_transfer_output=on_exit

output=out/remap_if_needed_transfer_needed

queue
^D

$ mkdir out

$ condor_status -format "%s\n" FileSystemDomain
A

$ condor_submit remap_transfer_not_needed.sub
Submitting job(s).
1 job(s) submitted to cluster 1300.

$ condor_history 1300 -l | grep -e Out -e Transfer
Out = "_condor_stdout"
WhenToTransferOutput = "ON_EXIT"
TransferErr = false
StreamOut = false
TransferFiles = "ONEXIT"
ShouldTransferFiles = "IF_NEEDED"
TransferOutputRemaps = "_condor_stdout=out/remap_if_needed_transfer_needed"
Requirements = ( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" ) && ( TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX" ) && ( TARGET.Disk >= DiskUsage ) && ( ( TARGET.Memory * 1024 ) >= ImageSize ) && ( ( RequestMemory * 1024 ) >= ImageSize ) && ( ( TARGET.HasFileTransfer ) || ( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain ) )
TransferIn = false

$ ls -al out
total 0
0 -rw-------. 1 matt matt 0 Jun 30 11:25 remap_if_needed_transfer_needed

$ ls -al _condor_stdout
4.0K -rw-r--r--. 1 matt matt 3 Jun 30 11:25 _condor_stdout

Accidental success - 

$ cat > remap_transfer_needed.sub
#NUM_CPUS = 1
#FILESYSTEM_DOMAIN = A
#STARTD.FILESYSTEM_DOMAIN = B
#STARTER.FILESYSTEM_DOMAIN = B
#STARTER_DEBUG = D_FULLDEBUG

cmd=/bin/echo
args=OK

should_transfer_files=if_needed
when_to_transfer_output=on_exit

output=out/remap_if_needed_transfer_needed

queue
^D

$ mkdir out

$ condor_status -format "%s\n" FileSystemDomain
B

$ condor_submit remap_transfer_needed.sub
Submitting job(s).
1 job(s) submitted to cluster 1301.

$ condor_history 1301 -l | grep -e Out -e Transfer
Out = "_condor_stdout"
WhenToTransferOutput = "ON_EXIT"
TransferErr = false
StreamOut = false
SpooledOutputFiles = "_condor_stdout"
TransferFiles = "ONEXIT"
ShouldTransferFiles = "IF_NEEDED"
TransferOutputRemaps = "_condor_stdout=out/remap_if_needed_transfer_needed"
Requirements = ( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" ) && ( TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX" ) && ( TARGET.Disk >= DiskUsage ) && ( ( TARGET.Memory * 1024 ) >= ImageSize ) && ( ( RequestMemory * 1024 ) >= ImageSize ) && ( ( TARGET.HasFileTransfer ) || ( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain ) )
TransferIn = false

$ ls -al out
total 4.0K
4.0K -rw-r--r--. 1 matt matt 3 Jun 30 11:32 remap_if_needed_transfer_needed

$ ls -al _condor_stdout
ls: cannot access _condor_stdout: No such file or directory

From the StartLog and StarterLog - 

$ grep "Remote job ID" /var/log/condor/StartLog
06/30/11 11:25:50 Remote job ID is 1300.0
06/30/11 11:32:11 Remote job ID is 1301.0

$ grep -e FsDomain -e IF_NEEDED /var/log/condor/StarterLog
06/30/11 11:25:50 Submit FsDomain: "A"
06/30/11 11:25:50  Local FsDomain: "A"
06/30/11 11:25:50 ShouldTransferFiles is "IF_NEEDED" and job's FileSystemDomain matches local value, NOT transfering files
06/30/11 11:32:11 Submit FsDomain: "A"
06/30/11 11:32:11  Local FsDomain: "B"
06/30/11 11:32:11 ShouldTransferFiles is "IF_NEEDED" but job's FileSystemDomain does NOT match local value, transfering files
remarks:
2011-Jun-30 10:56:12 by matt:
Note, it is not sufficient to skip the automatic remaps when IF_NEEDED is specified, because if IF_NEEDED -> YES the FileTransferObject will not honor the output location (output will go to PWD not the specified "out/" directory).

Possibly solutions include teaching the FileTransferObject about paths and ensuring remaps occur when transfer does not.
